com.urlisit.siteswrapper.cloud.server

Class DAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.urlisit.siteswrapper.cloud.server.DAO

  • public final class DAO
extends java.lang.Object
    DAO, (Data Access Object) is a non-instantiable utility class which provides static methods for accessing the JDOs (Java Data Objects) in the GAE (Google App Engine) Data-store. DAO provides a single point of access and is used to to perform Create, Read, Update and Delete operations against the Site, Style, Page and Information configuration JDOs.
    Since:
    04-10-2012
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Todd Url
    See Also:
    Site, Style, LookAndFeel, Page

    • Method Detail

      • updateSite

        public static void updateSite(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Updates the Site configuration object based on the parameters associated with an HttpServletRequest object. Populates the fields of the current Site object in the GAE Data-store by calling the getParameter methods of the HttpServletRequest parameter as arguments to the corresponding setField methods of the Site object having a vale of 'current' in it's revision field. At any moment in time there is only one Site object having a revision value of 'current', and it is that object which referred to as the current Site object and which is updated by the updateSite method. If the enableRevisionHistory field of the current Site object is true, updateSite sets the value of the revision field of the current Site object to 'previous' and creates a new Site object with a revision field value of 'current', thus creating a new current Site configuration object. Note a subsequent call to commitChange makes the new current Site configuration object permanent by setting the value of the revision field of the previous Site object to a string containing the current date and time. If the rollbackChange method is called instead of commitChange, the new current Site object is deleted and the value of the revision field in the previous Site object is set to 'current', rolling back the original updateSite method call.

        updateSite throws an IllegalStateException if any of the following conditions are detected.

        • The configurationDocId presented by the requesting client does not match the value configured in the appengine-web.xml file.
        • The access scheme, in the production environment, is http as opposed to https. This requirement does not apply in the development environment.
        • The http access method was anything other than an http post request.
        • The http post request originated outside the Google Docs domain.
        • The http post request was made from an agent other than a Google Apps Script.
        • The request originated from a country other than the US.
        Parameters:
        req -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Site

      • getSite

        public static Site getSite()
        Returns an object reflecting the current Site configuration. The object returned reflects the content of the datastore and consequently may not contain useful data. This is especially true in the case that there isn't a valid Site configuration object having the value of 'current' in it's revision property, such as the time between initial installation of the webapp and the initial update of the datastore. See Site for more information. In this case (the case of an invalid or empty Site configuration object), getSite will return an empty Site object. This condition can and should be tested for using the isEmpty() method of the returned Site object as in the following example usage; 
         Site site = Dao.getSite();
 if (site.isEmpty())
   doSomething(); // Log an error and call the configuration wizard
 else
   doSomethingElse()
        Returns:
        A Site configuration object.
        See Also:
        Site

      • getPageList

        public static java.util.List<Page> getPageList()
        Returns a List of current Page objects from the datastore. A Page object is considered current if the value of the revision field is set to 'current'. In the case that there are no current Page objects in the datastore, getPageList will return an empty List. This condition can and should be tested for using the isEmpty() method of the returned List object as in the following example usage; 
         List<Page> pages = Dao.getPageList();
 if (pages.isEmpty())
   doSomething(); // Log an error and call the configuration wizard
 else
   doSomethingElse()
        Returns:
        A List collection of Page objects
        See Also:
        Page

      • getItemList

        public static java.util.List<Item> getItemList()
        Returns a List of current Item objects from the datastore. An Item object is considered current if the value of the revision field is set to 'current'. In the case that there are no current Item objects in the datastore, getItemList will return an empty List. This condition can and should be tested for using the isEmpty() method of the returned List object as in the following example usage; 
         List<Item> items = Dao.getItemList();
 if (items.isEmpty())
   doSomething(); // Log an error and call the configuration wizard
 else
   doSomethingElse()
        Returns:
        A List collection of Item objects
        See Also:
        Item
